title: British Airways to launch direct flights from London Gatwick to Costa Rica
text:
136 shares 2

comments
Nestled in between the Pacific and Atlantic oceans, the tiny rainforested country of Costa Rica is often considered an oasis for explorers.
And soon travelling to the incredible country will be easier than ever for Brits wishing to immerse themselves in the tropical haven.
Starting in May next year, British Airways will be offering non-stop flights from Gatwick to San Jose, the Costa Rican capital.

Starting in May next year, British Airways will be offering non-stop flights from Gatwick to San Jose, the Costa Rican capital, and it will be easier than ever for fliers to witness sights such as the spectacular Congo Falls

The change will provide an opportunity to witness the diverse wildlife that lives in the tropical country
It is hoped the change will not only promote tourism to the country but also help to boost the local economy in the Central American country. Pictured is the island's Arenal Volcano

These direct flights will take place twice a week during summer, increasing to three a week for those craving a winter adventure.
Thrillseekers will be able to take part in rainforest hikes, white water rapids or surfing.
Animal-lovers will be spoilt for choice with everything from sloths to caiman and capuchins to dolphins calling the convervationist's dream their home.

Mauricio Ventura, Costa Rica's minister of tourism, said: 'British Airways' new service from Costa Rica to the United Kingdom is wonderful news.
'In the last 12 months alone we have seen an increase of 12.9 per cent of tourists from the United Kingdom visiting Costa Rica, staying an average of two weeks, helping to make a valuable contribution to the Costa Rican economy.

Colm Lacy, British Airways' head of commercial Gatwick, said: 'With everything from its incredible wildlife, rugged rainforests and volcanic peaks, as well as stunning beaches and – of course – world-famous coffee – Costa Rica offers an incredible array of places to visit and experience.
'Adding Costa Rica to our wide range of flights from Gatwick boosts our network and gives customers an even greater choice of diverse destinations.
'We're very excited to have the opportunity to fly nonstop between London and San Jose and we're sure this route will prove very popular with those looking for a holiday that's definitely out of the ordinary.'
During summer months the flights will run on Wednesday and Saturday with an average flying time of 10 hours and 50 minutes. Pictured La Paz waterfall (left) and a three-toed tree sloth with her baby in Corcovado National Park (right)
The stunning area of Manuel Antonio was listed by Forbes among the world's 12 most beautiful national parks in 2011
A Gatwick spokesperson said: 'We are delighted to welcome British Airways' nonstop flights between Gatwick and San Jose, Costa Rica – the latest addition to Gatwick's long-haul success story.
'Flights to long-haul destinations are the fastest growing of the more than 220 destinations that Gatwick flies to today.
'Gatwick's growth continues to reflect passengers' needs by providing them with more choice, value and destinations.'
Tourists will be able to take part in rainforest hikes, white water rapids, surfing and seeing some of the country's diverse wildlife
Prices for the flights start from £687 in World Traveller and rise to £2,532 in Club World with all taxes and charges included.
During summer months the flights will run on Wednesday and Saturday with an average flying time of 10 hours and 50 minutes.
In winter, flights will operate on Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday, with flights lasting 11 hours and 20 minutes.
The new long-haul route to San Jose follows the airline's recently launched route to Kuala Lumpur from Heathrow and a new Gatwick route to Funchal in Madeira.
Gatwick also launches new routes to Sharm El Sheikh and Vienna later this year.
In addition to British Airway, Thomson Airways will be offering direct flights to Costa Rica from November.
Mark Hall, Director of Product for Thomson and First Choice, said: 'We're thrilled to be launching Costa Rica as a new destination for holidaymakers and it is fantastic to be offering the only direct flight from the UK on our Dreamliner.
'It's an amazing country, with some really experiential excursions as well as great hotels. It adds further mix to our long haul flying programme, and most importantly offers something unique to our customers.'
